definition: to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

sentences.english: I have an inspector and two officers waiting at the front door .
sentences.chinese: 我已派了一個巡官和兩個警官守候在前門那裏。

sentences.english: Suffice it to say that the following responses of some umbelliferous plants have been observed .
sentences.chinese: 下面僅就已觀察到的幾種傘形科植物的反應予以說明。

sentences.english: The justice ' clerk assert that the justice is functi officio.
sentences.chinese: 法官的祕書宣稱法官已不再有管轄權。

sentences.english: Nine Thai officers from the anti-narcotics unit have since been charged with murder.
sentences.chinese: 泰國緝毒部隊的九名人員已被指控犯有謀殺罪。

sentences.english: The cases have been laboratory confirmed by the Institut Pasteur, Dakar.
sentences.chinese: 這些病例已得到達喀爾巴斯德研究所的實驗室確認。

sentences.english: Thank god I no longer feel this erotic desire.
sentences.chinese: 感謝主，我已不再有性慾望了。

sentences.english: Before I got these, my allergies would turn into weeks-long sinus infections.
sentences.chinese: 在我開始使用前，過敏症狀已變成持續幾周的鼻炎。

sentences.english: This branch is obsoleted. Engineering resource will no longer be invested on this branch in general.
sentences.chinese: 此分支已淘汰，除特殊狀況人力不再投注於此版上。

sentences.english: Although it is not expensive, we never seem to have quite enough money.
sentences.chinese: 雖然這是不昂貴的，我們從來沒有，似乎已很夠了錢。

sentences.english: Having been dehumanized in turn, they will embrace inhumanity and brutality.
sentences.chinese: 既已被非人化，他們將擁抱非人性和殘暴。

sentences.english: During Hellenistic times, Greek women also started to artificially wave and curl their hair.
sentences.chinese: 在希臘化時代期間，希臘女人就已開始人爲地捲髮了。

sentences.english: The Distributor is authorized to sub-contract and assign the distribution and sales of the Products to sub-contractors of Fangyuan Group.
sentences.chinese: 發行人已授權轉包及銷售此產品給方園集團的轉包商。

sentences.english: Through many dangers, toils, and snares I have already come.
sentences.chinese: 許多危險，試練網羅，我已安然經過。

sentences.english: Back to the room to sleep, you may have seen her with the quilt, the mother.
sentences.chinese: 回房睡覺，也許你已見她加上的被子，那個是母親。

sentences.english: This, it appears, is the legacy I have received and have now bequeathed to my own child.
sentences.chinese: 而這，正是我已收到並留給自己孩子的遺產。

definition: just at (that time)/right in (that place)/right in the middle of (doing sth)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to watch from a height or distance/to survey
not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
